intro: Scheelea corumbaensis, commonly known as the Corumbá palm, is a species of palm native to Brazil. It is characterized by its tall, slender trunk and pinnately compound leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in panicles, which are followed by bright red, fleshy fruits. Scheelea corumbaensis is adapted to tropical and subtropical climates, often growing in moist, well-drained soils. Its unique morphology and habitat make it an important species in its native ecosystem.
